poem:
### Court and Constitution

In chambers where justice's gavel falls,  
willful disobedience dances on air,  
a pirouette mocking the spine of law.  
Meanwhile, numbers climb walls,  
children steeped in silent codes.  
Who will decode the world's theorem?  
Promise me, promise all of us,  
the constellations will reveal  
not just stars, but answers.
